decisions.reasoning: Strong evidence: 10 conflicts + 10 escalations with 100% eventual approval and scores 93-95 indicates supervisor is creating unnecessary friction. This is a clear process inefficiency that wastes CEO cycles and delays shipping.
conditions: Must audit actual conflict cases first - don't just adjust thresholds blindly
Implement gradual rollout: start with 92+ auto-approve, monitor for 3 days
Maintain CEO escalation path for edge cases (security, architecture changes)
cascade_orders: Update supervisor prompt to auto-approve scores 92+
Document new escalation criteria in company-rules.md
All agents: conflicts should be rare exceptions, not routine friction

decisions.reasoning: Critical business need: $4.78 vs $2.00 budget (138% over) requires immediate visibility. Manual cost tracking delays corrective action. Real-time monitoring enables proactive cost control before budget blowouts.
conditions: Start with simple logging - don't over-engineer the dashboard
Alert threshold at 75% budget with CTO notification, 90% with CEO alert
Include breakdown by agent/model to identify cost drivers
Must not add >$0.10/sprint in monitoring overhead
cascade_orders: Orchestrator: log all API calls with cost metadata
All agents: be aware that cost monitoring is now active
Weekly cost reviews become standard in retrospectives
